Directions: Base your answer to the following questions on the information below and on your knowledge of science.
Content: A student dissolved a 40-gram block of a salt in 100 grams of warm water at 45°C. The solution was allowed to cool down to 24°C. The student noticed that some of the salt came out of the solution and settled to the bottom of the beaker. It is later determined that 12 grams of the salt came out of the solution.
